Description: Marl pottery vase tapering to a small flat base, short neck and everted roll over rim, decorated in red paint with sets of three thick vertical lines on three sides.
Curator's comments: Shape similar to Late ware L56B in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. It is probable (but cannot now be confirmed with certainty) that Mr. Legge, the donor of this and other objects, which he presented to the Museum in 1910, received them from the excavations of Ayrton and Loat at Mahasna in 1908-9, not those of Garstang at the same place in 1900-1. Legge worked at nearby Abydos in the same year in which Ayrton and Loat worked in the Predynastic cemetery at Mahasna (see 'Egypt Exploration Fund Arch. Report, 1908-9', 2, 5 ff.).
